_header: The mighty Maker of the major mound
Note:
There is a Pt. II, 18 ten-line stanzas, beginning ‘Thow man that is of power and smal valoue’: see Robbins (1975)
XRobbins, Rossell Hope. “Poems Dealing with Contemporary Conditions.” A Manual of the Writings in Middle English. Albert E. Hartung Vol. 5, fascicle 13. New Haven, CT: Connecticut Academy of Arts and Sciences, 1975: 1385-1536, 1631-1725, 1495.
Title(s): ‘Lamentacio domini Dalphini Francie pro morte uxoris sue dicte Margarete’
_description: ‘Lamentacio domini Dalphini Francie pro morte uxoris sue dicte Margarete’ — twenty-three l0-line stanzas (aabaabbcbc) inserted in Bk. XI of the Liber Pluscardensis

BodFair8.First Lines:
The myhti makar of þe moior mondeQuhille reuly rollis this
                    hevinly regions round…
BodFair8.Last Lines:
…Was put to deed with tyrannis cruelyQuhy suld we þan for
                    fair deed may or meyn
BodFair8.Note: Transcript, c. 1675, Oxford,  Bodleian Library Jones 8 (SC 8915), f. 555.
BodFair8.Attributed Title:
Incipit lamentacio dalphili francie pro morte uxoris sue dicte
                        margarete (f. 188)
BodFair8.Editions:
Stevenson,  Joseph,
                        ed.  
             The Life and Death of King James I of Scotland.
Maitland Club
         42. Edinburgh, 1837: 17.
Skene,  Felix James Henry,
                        ed.  
             Liber Pluscardensis.
             2 vols. 
             The Historians of Scotland
         vols. 7, 10. Edinburgh: Paterson, 1877-80: 7.382-88 (from transcript).

BodJones8.First Lines:
Thee myti makar of þe major mondeQuhille reuly rollis this
                    hevinly regions round …
BodJones8.Last Lines:
…And pray to Mary moder vergyn cleynThat for hir grace scho
                    bring ws to gud end
BodJones8.Note: Transcript, c. 1675, Oxford,  Bodleian Library Jones 8 (SC 8915), f. 555.
BodJones8.Attributed Title:
Incipit lamentatio Domini Delphini ffrancie pro morte uxoris sue dicte
                        Margarite (f. 555); Explicit consolatio rationis ad lamentantem
                    (at the end)
BodJones8.Editions:
Stevenson,  Joseph,
                        ed.  
             The Life and Death of King James I of Scotland.
Maitland Club
         42. Edinburgh, 1837: 17.
Skene,  Felix James Henry,
                        ed.  
             Liber Pluscardensis.
             2 vols. 
             The Historians of Scotland
         vols. 7, 10. Edinburgh: Paterson, 1877-80: 7.382-88 (from transcript).

Brussels4628.First Lines:
The michti makar of þe maior MondayQuhilk reuli reul yn
                    hevynli regiouns roundabout þis erd be motion circulerger al
                    þe cloudis of þe hevin habond…
Brussels4628.Attributed Title:
Incipit Lamentacio domini dalphini francie pro morte uxoris sue dicte
                        margarete (f. 229)
